abstract: The automaker said that its worldwide net income for the quarter fell 28 percent, hurt by slumping sales of its Tundra pickup truck and S.U.V.’s made and sold in North America.
snippet: The automaker said that its worldwide net income for the quarter fell 28 percent, hurt by slumping sales of its Tundra pickup truck and S.U.V.’s made and sold in North America.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Even Toyota Motor, Japan’s largest automaker, felt the pain in the first quarter from the collapsing market for big pickups and sport utility vehicles in the United States.

headline.main: Truck Sale Slump Weighs on Toyota
headline.print_headline: Slumping Truck Sales Weigh on Toyota in Quarter

headline.main: Toyota Profit Slips 28% as Truck Sales Fall
